required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Web-based Personalized Feedback for University Students
clinical_study.official_title: Randomized Controlled Trial of a Brief Personalized Feedback Intervention in University Students

lead_sponsor.agency: Centre for Addiction and Mental Health

clinical_study.source: Centre for Addiction and Mental Health

brief_summary.textblock: Excessive alcohol consumption in university students continues for be a serious public health concern with a variety of negative consequences. There have been a number of different brief interventions developed to address this issue among university students. The current project will add to this literature by evaluating the use of a personalized feedback intervention (www.CheckYourDrinkingU.net; CYDU). Specifically, this trial will examine whether providing access to the CYDU will result in short-term reductions in drinking. This issue is important as use of these interventions is not a mandatory requirement for university students so the issue is whether making materials of this type available leads to any reductions in risky drinking. It is hypothesized that students provided access to the CYDU will display greater reductions in drinking at a six-week follow-up as compared to students who were not provided access to the CYDU.

primary_outcome.measure: Alcohol Use Disorders Identification Test - Consumption scale (AUDIT-C scale)
primary_outcome.description: AUDIT-C is a scale that is a composite of three items - frequency of alcohol use, drinks per drinking day, and frequency of 5+ drinking occasions. Scores ranges from 0 to 12 with higher scores indicating more severe alcohol problems.

arm_group.description: Provided access to the Check Your Drinking University version (CYDU).

intervention.description: The CYDU is an internet-based intervention that provides a personalized feedback summary which compares the participant's drinking to that of other university students. The CYDU is a modified version of the Check Your Drinking screener which has been validated in four separate randomized controlled trials. The primary modification of the CYDU is that the population norms used for comparison are those of university students (in the USA or Canada).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- AUDIT-C score of 4 or more at baseline
Exclusion Criteria:

facility.name: Centre for Addiction and Mental Health

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Centre for Addiction and Mental Health
